intro: Fumaria officinalis var. major, commonly known as greater celandine, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems and alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its medicinal properties have been historically utilized in traditional herbal remedies. The plant thrives in moist, shady environments and is native to Europe and parts of Asia.
